intro: Racosperma olsenii, commonly known as the Mount Kosciuszko wattle, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its pod fruits and nitrogen-fixing abilities. The plant is a shrub that typically grows in dry, rocky environments, showcasing its adaptation to harsh conditions. Its yellow flowers appear in spring, adding vibrant color to its natural habitat. Racosperma olsenii is notable for its ecological significance and is often found in alpine regions of New South Wales.
